choices.C: The admin deleted the myApp/local directory before packaging.
choices.B: User role permissions are different on the new instance.
choices.A: The dashboard's permissions were set to private.

discussion.content:
The correct answer is AB
A. The dashboard's permissions were set to private. B. User role permissions are different on the new instance.

Selected Answer: AB
It's AB.
C - Is wrong because this would delete modifications made to the dashboard, not the dashboard itself.
D - It's wrong because dashboards are stored in the views folder. Not nav.

comments.content:
AB is the way.
D, Dashboard, if it was created in local this will be true.

questions.question_text: After updating a dashboard in myApp, a Splunk admin moves myApp to a different Splunk instance. After logging in to the new instance, the dashboard is not seen. What could have happened? (Select all that apply.)
Which of the following is a customization option for the Open in Search panel link button?

choices.C: Show link buttons at the bottom of a panel.
choices.D: Define an alternative search or target view to use.

discussion.content: Friends could you please confirm this answer

questions.question_text:
Which of the following are valid parent elements for the event action shown below? (Select all that apply.)
<set token=`Token Name`>sourcetype=$click.value|s$</set>

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. <change>
C. <change> <condition>
D. <drilldown> <condition>

The <eval> is a alternative to <set> as @New_user describe.
Answer is BCD. Eval fuction is used to set tokens without "set" command. See here: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Viz/PanelreferenceforSimplifiedXML

choices.D: Mean that the _key value must be passed as an argument.
choices.A: Clean the KV store, deleting all content.
choices.C: Cause all records in a collection to be deleted.
choices.B: Produce the syntax error ג€Key value missingג€.
